retract.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if you retract something that you said or agreed, you say that you did not mean it
retract.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: He confessed to the murder but later retracted his statement.

retract.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The sea otter can retract the claws on its front feet.
retract.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if a company retracts bonds, shares etc, it takes them off the market by buying them back from investors
retract.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: It will use its credit line to retract C$53.3 million in preferred shares.
retract.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to make an official statement saying that something you said earlier is not true
retract.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: A key witness hasretracted histestimony (=a statement in a law court) a year after the conviction.
